intro: Androsace minor, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
